wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Watson (1907 – after 1928) was an English footballer who played as a right back in the Football League for Darlington. He played non-league football for White-le-Head Rangers and Lintz Colliery, from where he signed professionally with Darlington in February 1929. He made his debut in the Third Division North match against New Brighton on 9 February, taking the place of Walter Holmes, and finished the season, and his Darlington career, with eleven appearances in the league.

response: Joseph or Joe Watson may refer to:
*Joe Watson (English footballer) (1906/1907 – after 1928), English footballer for Darlington
*Joe Watson (folklorist) (1881–after 1975), Australian folk singer, songwriter and traveling musician
